error.signature: TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'dispatch'). useContext must be used within a Provider
error.regex: (Cannot read properties of undefined.*useContext|useContext.*must be used within)

verdict.summary: useContext returns undefined because the component is not wrapped in the corresponding Provider.

dead_ends.action: Providing a default value in createContext to avoid the error
dead_ends.why_fails: Default value masks missing Provider; component uses stale/wrong data

dead_ends.action: Making the context value optional and checking everywhere
dead_ends.why_fails: Adds null checks throughout the codebase; verbose and error-prone

workarounds.action: Wrap the component tree with the Provider: <MyContext.Provider value={...}>
workarounds.how: Ensure the Provider is above the component that calls useContext in the tree

workarounds.action: Create a custom hook that throws if context is missing: useMyContext() with runtime check
workarounds.how: const ctx = useContext(MyCtx); if (!ctx) throw new Error('Missing Provider'); return ctx;

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'TypeError' indicates a useContext call outside its Provider, while 'Module not found' indicates a missing react-dom/client import.
